edu.bpl.pwsplugin.acquisitionManagers.fileSavers

Class SaverExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.bpl.pwsplugin.acquisitionManagers.fileSavers.SaverExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageSaver, java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Void>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageIOSaver

    public abstract class SaverExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageSaver, java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Void>
    Each time a new image is requested to be saved a new thread will be created to handle it. TODO: The usage of static variables was probably not smart. This should be split into two classes. One is the executor that handles executing tasks on a single thread. The other class represents the task that can be submitted to an executor. Rather than having two queues (images, and metadata) why not have one queue containing Image/metadata pairs.
    Author:
    Nick Anthony (nickmanthony@hotmail.com)
